Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Ptahhotep with a lappet-wig, a moulded face with a beard, parallel hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the cord of an incised seed-bag which hangs over one shoulder, there is a band of incised Hieroglyphs around the waist and a column running down the front of the legs, there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 662 "662. Another."; another referring to Miscellanea Antiquities 660 "660. A small earthen Ægyptian blew or green Isis?"
